resources.string: A dead animal must be treated with respect.
All animals have the right to the attention, care and protection of man.
All animals are born equal to life and have the same rights to existence.
Every animal has the right to be respected.
Every animal belonging to a wild species has the right to live freely in its own natural terrestrial, aerial or aquatic environment and to reproduce.

Every animal belonging to a species that traditionally lives in the environment of man, has the right to live and grow at the rhythm and in the conditions of life and freedom that are typical of its species.
Every animal chosen by man as a companion has the right that the duration of its life is in accordance with its natural longevity.
Every working animal has the right to a reasonable limitation of the time and intensity of work, to a restorative diet and to rest.
Any act that involves the unnecessary death of an animal is a biocide, that is, a crime against life.
Any act that involves the death of a large number of wild animals is genocide, that is, a crime against the species.
Any deprivation of liberty, even that for educational purposes, is contrary to this right.
Any modification of said rhythm or said conditions that was imposed by man, is contrary to said right.
If the death of an animal is necessary, it must be instantaneous, painless and non-distressing.
No animal will be subjected to mistreatment or cruel acts.
No animal will be exploited for the amusement of man.
The organisms for the protection and safeguarding of animals must be represented at the governmental level.
The rights of the animal must be defended by law, as well as the rights of man.
Animals raised for food should be fed, housed, transported and slaughtered without causing them anxiety or pain.
Alternative experimentation techniques must be used and developed.
Animal exhibits and shows that use them are incompatible with the dignity of the animal.
Violent scenes in which there are animal victims should be prohibited in the cinema and on television, unless their objective is to denounce the attacks against animal rights.

Animal experimentation that involves physical or psychological suffering is incompatible with animal rights, whether it be medical, scientific, commercial experiments, or any other form of experimentation.
Pollution and destruction of the natural environment lead to genocide.
Man, as an animal species, cannot claim the right to exterminate other animals or exploit them in violation of his right. You have the obligation to put your knowledge at the service of animals.
The abandonment of an animal is a cruel and degrading act.
